channel.title: Player files messed up? Please help!
channel.description: [center]Ok so im extremely new to RSPS's (Owning one anyways) this is my first one but here is the issue im having.. When ever i make a new player it saves like this http://gyazo.com/ad172aa81bf40eef782faccdb929a3b7 And when i open it then it looks like this http://gyazo.com/b0172e63988ff556969abe04af769ce2 How do i fix this?[/center]

item.title: Player files messed up? Please help!
item.dc:creator: @thakillah thakillah
item.description:
@thakillah wrote:

You can’t change p files you don’t need to change the player right there

go to player. Java search for king_zenith change to ur name safe compile done

Read full topic
item.source: Player files messed up? Please help!

item.title: Player files messed up? Please help!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:7, topic:468844”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=585843.msg4161308#msg4161308 date=1353127882]
It’s not a problem. It is a design choice. The creators of the server did not want the player data to be saved in a plaintext format (probably due to the increased size) so they save it as the raw player object created by the server. Unless you know exactly how the file is saved/loaded, messing with it by hand could make the file unreadable by the server.
[/quote]
That is pointless. The majority of numbers in char file are less than 4 char’s long. So this actually increases most of the space. if value <1000 then it would be wasting space >_<[/quote]

Not really. If you look, each character file is only 8KB. Winterlove-type character saves can exceed well over 100KB with all the crap people put in.

Read full topic
item.source: Player files messed up? Please help!

item.title: Player files messed up? Please help!
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

zyle1992:

It’s not a problem. It is a design choice. The creators of the server did not want the player data to be saved in a plaintext format (probably due to the increased size) so they save it as the raw player object created by the server. Unless you know exactly how the file is saved/loaded, messing with it by hand could make the file unreadable by the server.

That is pointless. The majority of numbers in char file are less than 4 char’s long. So this actually increases most of the space. if value <1000 then it would be wasting space >_<

Read full topic
item.source: Player files messed up? Please help!

item.title: Player files messed up? Please help!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

It’s not a problem. It is a design choice. The creators of the server did not want the player data to be saved in a plaintext format (probably due to the increased size) so they save it as the raw player object created by the server. Unless you know exactly how the file is saved/loaded, messing with it by hand could make the file unreadable by the server.

item.title: Player files messed up? Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Kwuiz Kwuiz
item.description:
@Kwuiz wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:2, topic:468844”]its not broken, you are.
lol the variable saved in the file is an integer, not a string.
(the spaces are 4 bytes long, meaning integer.
If it is a newer server it might be set up that way. I started with 317’s which are much more stupid friendly ;D[/quote]
Ok so how do i fix this so i can make my self owner? Like i said im new to this and kinda need help haha

Read full topic

item.title: Player files messed up? Please help!
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

its not broken, you are.
lol the variable saved in the file is an integer, not a string.
(the spaces are 4 bytes long, meaning integer.
If it is a newer server it might be set up that way. I started with 317’s which are much more stupid friendly ;D
